frameDefinitions: A trial is a process conducted in a Court before a Judge and (usually) a Jury in which the participants meet in order to decide a Case.
A Defendant is tried by a Jury or Judge in a Court for Charges.
A salient Subevent has a Pattern of recurrence within a larger Process.
This frame describes the process that involves the inquiry and determination by an authority, the Investigator, of the circumstances surrounding an Incident perpetrated by a Suspect.
Authorities charge a Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the Charges), and take him/her into custody.'

The words in this frame have to do with a Speaker asking an Addressee a question which calls for a reply (as opposed to making a request which calls for an action on the part of the Addressee).  '' 'We asked Ruby what kind of food they ate.'
frameExamples: The state will <t>try</t> him for fraud.
Tony's fingers tapped <t>rhythmically</t> on the keyboard
The police are <t>investigating</t> the bank's reported loss of several thousand dollars from their downtown branch's top security vault. DNI
The police <t>arrested</t> Harry on charges of manslaughter.
We <t>asked</t> Ruby what kind of food they ate.
listRoleDefinitions: The legal label for the crime that the <fen>Defendant</fen> is accused of.
The specific room where the participants in a Trial meet.

The individual or group which is responsible for promoting the welfare of the  <fen>Defendant</fen> during a Trial, usually involving the contention that the <fen>Defendant</fen> is innocent of the <fen>Charges</fen>.
The group of individuals who observe the Trial and ultimately attempt to come to a verdict.
The individual or group responsible for promoting the interests of the state in the Trial, prototypically including presenting arguments for the guilt of the <fen>Defendant</fen>.
The person charged with an offence.
The official who directs and presides over the Trial.
The <fen>Case</fen> which a Trial is convened to decide.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the trial occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the trial occurs.
The <fen>Judge</fen> heads the <fen>Court</fen> where the case is tried.  An expression referring to the <fen>Court</fen> may also stand in for the <fen>Judge</fen>.
The <fen>Defendant</fen> is being tried for the <fen>Charges</fen> in <fen>Court</fen>.

This role identifies the people who are charged by the <fen>Court</fen> to listen to the testimony, evidence, and arguments, and come to a consensus about the guilt or innocence of the <fen>Defendant</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Charges</fen> brought against the <fen>Defendant</fen>.
The <fen>Defendant</fen> is tried under the laws of the <fen>Governing_authority</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the case is tried.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the case is tried.
The larger event that is characterized by the recurring Subevents.
The salient, punctual event that is construed as part of a <fen>Process</fen>.
The <fen>Pattern</fen> that can be detected in the recurrence of  the <fen>Subevent</fen>s of the <fen>Process</fen> .
The <fen>Investigator</fen> is the person or agency that investigates the <fen>Suspect</fen> of a crime (<fen>Incident</fen>).

The <fen>Investigator</fen> attempts to determine the exact circumstances surrounding the <fen>Incident</fen>, which is typically a criminal act (murder, robbery) or the result of such an act (death, loss of money).
This role denotes the <fen>Suspect</fen> that is investigated by the <fen>Investigator</fen>.
When the <fen>Investigator</fen> investigates the <fen>Incident</fen>.
<fen>Charges</fen> identifies a category within the legal system; it is the crime with which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is charged.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> charge the <fen>Suspect</fen> with commiting a crime, and take him/her into custody.
The <fen>Suspect</fen> is taken into custody, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
<fen>Offense</fen> identifies the ordinary language use of the reason for which a <fen>Suspect</fen> is arrested.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the arrest occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arrest occurs.
The person asking a question generally occurs as the External Argument of verb and noun targets:

The Addressee is most frequently the NP Object of a target verb.  However, with the verb <ment>inquire</ment>, Addressee can only occur as an <ment>of</ment>-PP and with a noun target, Addressee occurs in a PP Complement or as a possessive :
The Message, or content of the question, usually takes the form of a direct quote or an embedded question with a verb target:
Topic occurs very frequently in this frame with both noun and verb targets. It generally occurs as a PP Complement:
The time at which the questioning occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Judge Murphy</fex> will try the defendant for murder.
<fex>The United States</fex> will try the accused bomber in a federal courthouse.
The rhythm <fex>of the rain falling on the roof</fex> kept me awake
The music had a driving rhythm
Our guys are <fex>currently</fex> investigating her disappearance.
The police arrested Harry <fex>on charges of manslaughter</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.
The police arrested <fex>Harry</fex> on charges of manslaughter.
The police arrested Harry <fex>on Wednesday afternoon</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>in front of his house</fex>.
<fex>Pat</fex> quizzed me about where I had been.
Pat questioned <fex>me</fex> about where I had been.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
